metadata.title: CVE-2024-28219 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In _imagingcms.c in Pillow before 10.3.0, a buffer overflow exists becausestrcpy is used instead of strncpy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-28219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm2
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm2
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm2
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm2
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm2').
